textile.post: According Atanasius, Pope Sylvester I (314/335) ordinated that the Sacrifice should be offered not on a silk or colored cloth but only on a white linen cloth. “Constitutio sancti Silvestri papae statuit ut sacrificium altaris non in serico, neque in panno tincto celebretur, nisi tantum in lineo terreno procreato, sicut corpus domini nostri Jhesu Christi in syndone munda sepultum est”.
